description: From Middle English semly, semely, semelich, from Old Norse sœmiligr (“seemly”); equivalent to seem +‎ -ly. Cognate with Icelandic sæmilegur (“seemly, passable”), Danish sømmelig (“seemly”).

entries.meaning: (of behavior) Appropriate; suited to the occasion or purpose; becoming.
examples: His behavior was seemly, as befits a gentleman.

adverbs.description: seemly (comparative more seemly, superlative most seemly)
